page.title: 03ARKESDEN VILLAGE
page.content: {Arkesden}is an amenity village; new building is very much restricted. The{population}is about 260 with only 1 shop and 1 pub. Very attractive with over 25 thatched cottages and others of great charm.Evidence of inhabitants from the Bronze Age in local Museum. Electricity came to the village about 30 years ago but still no main drainage. New building has been on edge of the village including 18 council houses. The Stream,Wicken Water, which flows through the village rises at the highest point in Essex.{Farming}is almost entirely arable, mainly wheat and barley, but some bullocks and pigs kept. 2{places of worship}- Methodist Chapel and Parish Church (St. Mary the Virgin). (summarised from J.B.Barnes' Guide)
